column2: so I've held off on trying this sandwich until very recently. Why spend $11.50 on a banh mi
column4: when I can buy a legit one for $2.50 from Midtown? But
column6: if I'm going to write a review about Local Foods
column7: I should have it once so I can credibly tell people to pass on it. The joke was on me though
column8: because the banh mi is quite delicious. And to be fair
column9: Local Foods doesn't claim that it's traditional; they put it in quotation marks on the menu. So get the banh mi if you're craving pork or want to try Local Foods' interpretation of the classic.
